body: As of b2ea8d5bf3228a07996057a533cd3880f0e6a4d1 `sebastian/diff ^2.0` is already allowed but the code is not ready for it.
@SpacePossum It would be great if you could send a pull request that makes PHPUnit 6.2 compatible with `sebastian/diff ^2.0`.

repository.name: comparator
repository.description: Provides the functionality to compare PHP values for equality.

body:
I have pulled the `2.0.0` release of `sebastian/diff` because of the mistake I mentioned in https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/2734#issuecomment-314440796. Not sure why I did that, probably because back in May there was not a BC break in the diff component's code (and the only reason for the bump of the major version was that PHP 5 was no longer supported).

As a result of this mistake, PHPUnit 6.1.4, 6.2.0, 6.2.1, 6.2.2, and 6.2.3 allowed the installation of the `2.0.0` release of `sebastian/diff` but, of course, the code of these releases is not compatible.

The only solution that I saw to fix this mess was to 1) pull the `2.0.0` release of `sebastian/diff` and 2) skip that major version and release the current `master` of diff as `3.0.0` (not done yet).

Makes sense, sorry for getting you into this trouble.

We could update `sebastian/diff` to make v2 compat with PHPUnit 6.1.4, 6.2.0, 6.2.1, 6.2.2, and 6.2.3.
It would only require a change in the constructor of the `Differ` class, let me know if you want me to try it out.
but that would actually be one-liner change... so not a big thingy, right? :)
and with deprecation notice when used with v1-style :D

would look something like https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/diff/pull/66/files
(without deprecation notice, as I'm not sure how this done in the PHPUnit ecosystem ATM)

down side is that we've to test the type of the arg a bit better, like `new Differ(1)` would result in problems later on

Here is what I get with current PHPUnit `6.2` branch and current `2.0` branch of `sebastian/diff`:

Most fails seems false negatives but I'll do a check soon. I can prep. something for this by checking the `diff` version used. Hope to pick it up soon!

Hi, sorry for getting back so late on this.
Been very busy and need some good time to finish this. I'll be away for 3 weeks after today so that doesn't help either.
Little start I've made https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/pull/2748

### Status Update

* #2748 currently confuses me more than it helps (I do appreciate your work, though! Just means that I need to think hard(er) to make use of it.)
* There is currently no release of `sebastian/diff` `^2.0` so it does not get pulled in (unless you have `"minimum-stability": "dev"` in your `composer.json`, in which case you are on your own anyway
* Once PHPUnit is compatible with `sebastian/diff` `^2.0`, version `2.0.1` of `sebastian/diff` will be released
* `sebastian/comparator` version `2.0.2` has been tagged with the compatbility changes for `sebastian/diff` `^2.0`

issue.title: WIP / POC - start of fixing tests with diff 2.0
issue.body:
Changes in `composer.json` should be reverted in the end.... but lets first fix the tests and see if all is OK with diff 2.x

Alright... so... the issue there is now is that `comparator` v.2 is released with a `diff only` output format.
This means we don't get the udiff `@@ @@` header.
Tried to correct here https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/comparator/pull/40

Other way would be to change the `diff only` output builder  to be just like `udiff` in the `diff` package. Than in correct the output builder used by `comparator` in `comparator 3`. This can be done because `diff 2` is not released yet.

body:
Hi @sebastianbergmann ,

I've returned from my 3 weeks absence. My apologies for the confusion caused by my PR's and issues I created just before my leaving. Although I had the intentions to finish those, in the end I just run out of time.
Nice to see it all (`diff v2` and integration into `comparator` and `phpunit`) work out!

Thank you for picking this up and finishing it!

I'll go over the PR's, commits and issues on the various repo's the upcoming days to see if anything is left to do. Please let me know if you know of anything as I might miss somethings during this catch-up.
